comment.author: 68985493@N06
comment._content: No idea where it is, but this looks like it might be part of the extensive canal system in Ireland that still exists today. I love the shot! Very picturesque and interesting - but there are too many people in that boat methinks!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/terryhnb] Well, I think there was rather more posing than purported boating going on here! Happy enough that it was somewhere near Lurgan, but (as always) would like to pin it down...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 40911801@N00
comment._content: There is a Kinnego townland and a Kinnego Bay - both just north of Lurgan on the Lough Neagh shore. There look to be numerous inlets that might match the one illustrated. That area continues to be a popular sailing centre - in fact, I spent a weekend sailing at Oxford Island back in the day.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/achesonblog] Kinnego sounds very promising, thank you! I'll check it out...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 76983705@N05
comment._content: Just seen this - I was brought up in 40's near Lurgan and am sure there was/is a Kinnego.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/76983705@N05] Think you're absolutely right! Have added location as Kinnego Marina... Thank you.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 88597506@N06
comment._content: I live near and photograph this area, and i don't recognise it. Although it is over 100 years ago, the canal and the kerbing are not familiar. It could be near Kinnego, but i don't it is here. Sorry to disappoint!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/88597506@N06] Hmm, well then, we await further comment on the location of this one...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
